H0.text: Fragmentation is the process of breaking an individual into parts followed by regeneration.

H1.text: Minimization is the process of breaking an individual into parts followed by regeneration.

H2.text: Erosion is the process of breaking an individual into parts followed by regeneration.

H3.text: Destruction is the process of breaking an individual into parts followed by regeneration.

A4.text: Fragmentation (medicine), an operation that breaks of solid matter in a body part into pieces, such as kidney stones

A5.text: Fragmentation (weaponry), a feature of explosive weaponry

A6.text: Each of these fragments develop into mature, fully grown individuals that are clones of the original organism.

A7.text: In echinoderms, this method of reproduction is usually known as fissiparity.

A8.text: A planarian parent, for example, will constrict, split in the middle, and each half generates a new end to form two clones of the original.

A9.text: Some animals are able to reproduce asexually through fragmentation, budding, or fission.
